alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued January 09 at 3:59AM HST until January 10 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING UNTIL MONDAY MORNING FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU, KAUAI, OAHU, MOLOKAI, NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI, AND WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .The first in a series of northwest swells will peak this morning, then slowly lower through Monday. Two additional large northwest swells will arrive later this week. ...HIGH SURF WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST MONDAY... * WHAT...Surf heights along north facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, and Maui will range from 20 to 35 feet today, lowering into the 20 to 30 feet range tonight and 20 to 25 feet by Monday morning. Surf heights along west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, and Molokai will range from 15 to 22 feet today, lowering to 12 to 16 feet by Monday morning. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, and Molokai, and north facing shores of Maui. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Monday. * IMPACTS...High. Expect ocean water occasionally sweeping across portions of beaches, very strong breaking waves, and strong longshore and rip currents. Breaking waves may occasionally impact harbors making navigating the harbor channel dangerous.
info.instruction: Large, breaking surf, significant shorebreak, and dangerous currents make entering the water very hazardous. Anyone entering the water could face significant injury or death.
